Author: CiPhEr#2091
Content:
question- when placing a trade on atomicdex, it looks like the transaction fee for a coin is not dependent on the amount traded, however the trading fee goes up in relation to amount listed. 
I'm assuming this trading fee, upon listing an offer for sale on the dex, is for full amount being sold. So, if a taker chooses to trade for say, only half the amount I have listed, this trading fee for this transaction would be half as well, right?
Also- It appears the transaction fee is based solely on the coin being sold by the maker and has nothing to do with what coin it is being paid for by the taker, correct?

Author: cipi#4502
Content: @J.J. problem with AXE identified: for some reason AXE-transactions can take a very long time to propagate to the mempool of other nodes (AtomicDEX waited 50s then gave up)... problem "solved" by directly connecting the wallet of the maker node with the ones from the electrums... but this is more a AXE problem, then a AtomicDEX problem, txs should not take that long to make it into the mempool of other nodes

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
@CiPhEr the transaction fee is the normal network fee for the involved chains and not dependent on the amount
trading fee (dexfee) is 1/777 of the takercoin amount (maker pays no dexfee)

Author: cipi#4502
Content: this also means: coins with high txfees (BTC, often ERC20) should be swapped in bigger amounts, else txfee can be a significant part of traded amount

Author: dan.#2473
Content: Will the min amount be raised for certain coins?

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
the min. amount is now fixed at 0.00777 for all coins
but i would like to have the possibility to set it for each coin in part, so i made this issue: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/atomicDEX-API/issues/473

Author: CiPhEr#2091
Content: ok thanks cipi üôÇ

Author: CiPhEr#2091
Content:
one other question- say my phone loses connection, how long do i have to get it back online and go back into adex if i am in the middle of a swap to have it complete?
and if i don't make it in time, the locked transaction goes back into my wallet at a certain time?

Author: dan.#2473
Content: Can I suggest at the very least having the option to disable in settings.

Author: dan.#2473
Content: The reason being is that in its current state atomicdex cannot be used for dust

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
that also depends on the involved coins, not sure though
i think with BTC and BCH you have more time to get back online and ccontinue the swap
if the swap fails (timeouts or other error) and if funds were already been sent, they are refunded
the time also depends on the chains... here i am sure that it is that way, but not how long the times are exactly... 4h or something like that

Author: CiPhEr#2091
Content: ok thanks

Author: cipi#4502
Content: @dan. don't know how much sense it makes to send small amounts and pay a higher fee then the transferred amount... better "collect" the dust üôÇ

Author: dan.#2473
Content: Sure in the instances where it makes sense to. But in its current form of 0.00777 that isn't always the case depending on the crypto

Author: dan.#2473
Content: I know this is an edge case but it would likely increase usage a little bit if people could dust out their wallets with atomicdex

Author: cipi#4502
Content: sure, the fixed 0.00777 was/is just a quickfix and will be changed

Author: dan.#2473
Content: Alright. I get the safegaurd, but it would be good to see it changed

Author: dan.#2473
Content: Thanks for answering

Author: looye29#2126
Content: Any change you add CKB to DeX?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content:
@looye29 
Adding it to marketmaker is free if it's compatible:
https://developers.atomicdex.io/basic-docs/atomicdex/atomicdex-tutorials/additional-information-about-atomicdex.html#add-your-coin-to-marketmaker-2-0

Adding it to mobile DeX has a listing fee, and you need to contact the team.

Author: Acura#2748
Content: It would be great if the wallet actually told the user that this was the problem instead of telling to try later if a user wants to withdraw BTC to an Segwit Adress.

Author: Bitfinger#6245
Content: Imo it would be better if segwit was supported as it would be more compatible and potentially reduce fees for trading and deposit/withdrawal

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: I think the team will add segwit in the future

Author: Bitfinger#6245
Content: If you also add custom TX fees I think it could be a very competitive multi-coin mobile wallet as well as a Dex. Looking at Dexstats it seems btc/kmd has the most volume so it should be seriously considered

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/atomicDEX-API/commit/555b51d20cd4f4e87bbe4e06818abd95dbef2649
segwit already added to API and i tested it with a dozen of coins or so
every coin that has `"segwit": true` in the coin file: https://github.com/jl777/coins/blob/master/coins
the next AtomicDEX-GUI release will have it too... just wait couple of days üòâ

Author: cipi#4502
Content: you can also use custom fees with the API on withdraw... there are also some fee handling things WIP  so this will improve in the future... just have a look at the issues with the word "fee" in the name: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/atomicDEX-API/issues

Author: Bitfinger#6245
Content: Excellent to hear that, thanks @cipi

Author: marktyler#0324
Content: @PTYX have an atomic dex issue, tried to make a swap with kmd. It timed out after an hour. Komodo never refunded back to me. Suggestions?

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: I'm not entirely sure how to fix failed swaps if the kmd wasn't returned. Do you have a transaction ID? @marktyler

Author: cipi#4502
Content:
there are no infos about this swap uuid on the seed nodes
you need to look in the logfiles on your device
are you sure that anything was sent?
dexfee is not refunded, only MakerPayment and TakerPayment
you can now lookup the errors that happened with a swap with this link: http://dexapi.cipig.net:8080/public/error.php?uuid=c65d9539-11ec-4d35-8d02-eb3f3ed2aa52 (if there is anything on the seed nodes)
